summary: The National Nuclear Security Administration maintains the nuclear stockpile. To analyze the performance, safety, and reliability of nuclear weapons, it acquires high-performance computing systems for simulations. The latest system is expected to be complete in 2024. Is NNSA following best practices to acquire this $600 million system? NNSA could have done a better job considering alternatives. For example, NNSA's analysis of alternatives was not conducted...
title: High-Performance Computing: NNSA Could Improve Program Management Processes for System Acquisitions
